title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5906.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5906.2 - Definitions

State Regulations

For the purposes of this Part: (a) The term declaratory ruling shall mean a
decision issued by the foundation which either determines: (1)
the applicability to any person, property, or state of facts of any rule enforceable by the foundation; or
(2)
whether any action should be
taken by the foundation pursuant to a rule. Such a declaratory rule shall be binding on the foundation
unless it is altered or changed by a court or is changed by the foundation to
be effective prospectively. No opinion, letter, announcement or other
communication by the foundation shall be deemed to be a declaratory ruling
unless it contains a statement that it is a declaratory ruling or it is a
ruling issued in response to a petition submitted pursuant to this
section. (b) The
term foundation means the New York State Science and Technology

Foundation. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
5906.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
